alert.note: Alert for Delta (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 11:52AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. For the Sturgeon River in Delta County...including Nahma Junction... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, water overflows the banks along the river * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT.
